1.brief: intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
David, the youngest son of Jesse
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

2.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
near, with or among; often in general, to

the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
near, with or among; often in general, to
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative

thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken

tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:

the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property

a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)

the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides

11.brief: properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

12.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the heart (as the most interior organ);

properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

lowermost; as noun (feminine plural) the depths (figuratively, a pit, the womb)

to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before

15.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

16.brief: to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

17.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a signal (literally or figuratively), as aflag, beacon, monument, omen, prodigy, evidence, etc.

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to surround, i.e. protect or aid
properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself)
